question.title: Why does IntelliJ not see sources of main from another source set?
question.body:
IntelliJ fails to see classes located within "src/main/java" when editing from another source set.

Relevant sourceSets configuration:

sourceSets {
    named("main") {
        java.srcDirs(
            "src/main/java",
            "src/another-source/java"
        )
    }
    val sourceOne by creating {
        java.srcDirs(
            "src/main/java",
            "src/another-source-2/java"
        )
    }
    val sourceTwo by creating {
        java.srcDirs (
            "src/main/java",
            "src/yet-another-source/java"
        )
    }
}

Putting implementation(project(":")) in each dependencies block for each source set "fixes" intellij's issue, but gradle works fine without, and putting that doubles build time since gradle must compile main before compiling sourceOne.

question_comments.body: I find it a little strange to have the same directory in multiple source sets. That could be confusing IntelliJ, though you say Gradle handles it just fine so the problem could be something else. Or maybe I'm not understanding what IntelliJ is failing to do.
